description:
This is the Starbucks most go to before Moscone, mainly Moscone West since down the block and same side of the street. The interesting part is that there is another Starbucks right across the street too, but not as popular. 

This is a popular location for me, due to a Pokemon Go Ex Raid stop.
author: M C.

description:
Extremely slow service... it took us 15 mins to order with only 3 ppl in front of us in the line...

They keep getting people's orders wrong and talking to each other.
author: Sevda G.

description:
In town for 4 days - 4 trips to this location as it was across from where I was staying and 4 days with no simple syrup.  I am pretty sure the classic or simple syrup is used in multiple drinks so I would think they could have gotten some in four days.

I also felt like the milk and sugar area was really dirty regardless of what time I went - which ranged from 7AM to 2PM
author: Melody K.

description:
I went out drinking the night before, so I needed food the next day. My usual Starbucks didn't have the breakfast sandwich I wanted, so I decided to stop by this one. (I did mobile ordering, so I found out before I left that this location had my sandwich.) I stopped by on Thursday, April 19th around 10am.

I get a lot of Starbucks gift cards at work, so they come in handy when I need breakfast. I normally get the Sausage, Cheddar & Egg Breakfast Sandwich: A Southern-style sausage patty, fluffy eggs and aged Cheddar cheese are served on a toasty English muffin ($3.75). Similar to a sandwich I adore at a restaurant with some golden arches, I've found this satisfies my breakfast craving. And since I have a Starbucks balance, they are free! Yay for that! Though normally, the sandwich is rather misshapen as I think they just throw the sandwich into their bag after toasting. It's more or less always lopsided.

This location is close to Moscone, so if there's a convention, it does get rather busy. There is another Starsbucks directly across the street on Mission right by the Target, so if this one is crazy, you have another option close by. Since I did mobile ordering, I didn't even have to interact with anyone. I went to the mobile ordering area, found my breakfast sandwich, and then left.

Decent location. If you're in a hurry, I highly recommend mobile ordering. It's so easy and fast!
author: Elena N.

description:
Came here to get some studying in after failing to find a spot at the overcrowded Peet's Coffee. Super spacious Starbucks area! No wait to order my drink and breakfast sandwiches. It's located across the street from another Starbucks so maybe that's why there isn't as many people there as I expected on a Wednesday evening? I'm not complaining though! 

Super friendly staff too!
author: Nenette T.

description:
This is our neighborhood starbucks and it's usually nicer than most.  It's big, there's ample seating, and it's clean.  This last time though, made me want to walk a little farther for another Starbucks...

We were on our way to a weeknight movie at Century, and because we're old, my girlfriend needed a little pick me up so she could stay awake and enjoy the movie.  We ordered using mobile order as soon as we closed our door.  We got to starbucks in probably less than 10 minutes, and our drinks were waiting.  She ordered a hot drink with coconut milk, and I ordered an iced coffee.  On the bar waiting for us was 2 iced drinks.  She was ready to walk out and not ask for a hot drink, but it was a cold night.  I asked them to make the drink hot like she had ordered and the guy apologized (probably the manager), and asked this other guy to make the drink.  The other guy argued that we ordered an iced drink, and the first guy told him to "read the label".  Also, the drink was made with regular coffee (we ordered decaf), because the manager explained that it "was supposed to be decaf too."  We were a little concerned at this point, so we watched him make the drink. He didn't use coconut milk, we watched him pour regular milk into the drink, and I don't think he made the latte "vanilla bean" as per our order.  When I asked for clarification when he handed the drink to me, I was met with the rudest response, that may as well have been an F you.  He said, "yep", and went back to making drinks.  

It's a shame the service here is so terrible because of the positive atmosphere I mentioned above.  Don't trust these baristas to make your drink accurately.  Clearly the manager needs to train his staff.
author: Ashley S.

description: Waited 25 min for a breakfast sandwich... had to ask 2 baristas before they even checked why it wasn't ready. Apparently they didn't know what happened to my order. No apology or anything when I finally got my food. I get this is a busy location, but at least have a basic level of customer service
author: Amit B.

description:
Closest Starbucks to my hotel, a short line because they are quick. Lots of people order using their app, so that helps. Big turnover, so everything was fresh, from the coffee to the food. 

Quick, friendly and great coffee. Everything you want in a Starbucks
author: Cosmo W.

description: Don't bother placing a mobile order at this Starbucks.  They prioritize their regular line at a ludicrous ratio and get annoyed with you when you ask about your plain iced coffee that takes 20 minuets to be served.
author: Sean H.

description: It's a pretty terrible Starbucks I gotta say. They staff was rude. Without anyone complaining, one barista starts telling everyone in line "We are only two people and it will be a little bit of a wait" and to any customer that inquired he said "we told you that you'd have to wait a little bit" we get it, there's only two people but that's pretty crappy customer service.
author: Nahaly S.

description: Pretty sure this staff is the bitchiest I've yet come across. I haven't seen baristas ignore customers or get names wrong in a long while.
author: Cody R.

description:
I used to be a strict Peet's girl when it came to coffee chains, but this store has quickly converted me. 

The service here is always exemplary. Lis is the cheeriest, most hard-working barista. She is my absolute favorite! Say is also suuuper sweet; she always brightens up my day. Nella is wonderful too. 

Most of the girls who work here are great, very friendly and efficient. I can't remember all of their names, but I will update my review as I figure them out. Other Starbucks can't compare with this one. The store across the street pales in comparison. I admire their grace and poise when the lines get long & people start to get impatient and cranky while waiting for their caffeine fix. You go, girls!

The Starbucks app is also easy to use, and I earn rewards very quickly. The iced lattes give me a nice buzz and always power me through a long workday. I occasionally add a little vanilla for sweetness. Their espresso drinks always have a wonderful flavor.

They offer soy, coconut, or almond milk if you prefer your beverages dairy-free. There is a 60 cent upcharge, but I'll gladly pay a little extra for quality drinks and stellar service. 

Keep up the great work, y'all! Other stores should take notes about how it's done. You rock.
author: Brandi W.

description: I've been to this SB multiple times over the years. It gets really busy in AMs when it's work crowds and when conventioneers are in town. Front desk staff isn't friendly here. But they're not nasty either.  The lady who emptied the trash when I was there yesterday was friendliest. I had soy lattes twice over 2 days and they were both good. The area leaves much to be desired. Too many homeless and the sidewalks in the Downtown area always smell of urine. SF public works dept does nothing to clean the streets.
author: Ry T.

description: What brings this Starbucks down to a one star. This Starbucks has resident homeless people that sleep and bring extension cords to charge their phones and no baristas reprimand the homeless in this particular Starbucks. This is totally unacceptable and the Starbucks Corporate office should do something about this.The homeless sleep on the tables. I have never seen anything like this before at any Starbucks!!! The service is great but it always very dirty. Disgusting!!!!
author: Michael P.

description: Always have my mobile order perfect and on time. I appreciate this! Stopped going to the one down the street because they would always wait 15 mins to start my order... ugh.
author: Taya S.

description: This Starbucks has the advantage of being open later than the other surrounding locations, it closes at 9pm on weekdays. It's also centrally located, near the Westfield mall, AMC, and adjacent to Target. However, when I visiting this location last night, I was disappointed in how unkept and unclean the store was - the tables were either extremely rickety or really dirty to sit at, even though there were seats available, many customers opted to stand and talk instead. Additionally, some of the customers were openly rude to others, and were disruptive to the general atmosphere that eventually I felt uncomfortable enough to leave, which I have never had to do at a Starbucks before. The last negative point was that there was no specific Starbucks wifi, only Target, but it was free so that didn't make a huge impact. The only reason this review is 2 stars instead of 1 is that service was prompt and cheerful, I felt like the baristas did a good job. But even though this is one of the Starbucks locations open this late, I don't think I'll be making my way to do some work at that location in the evening again.
author: Marites S.

description: Bad service and unfriendly staff. Could barely get her to say more to me than "do you want whip cream". Acted like I made her go completely out of her way to print me a receipt since I'm traveling on business. Drinks were poorly made and sloppy presentation. Wasn't impressed at all.
author: Cierra E.

description:
Horrible service. On top of the unfriendly bathroom policy they now charge $ 2.50 for a cup of hot water instead of the .25 cents of a Whole Foods or any other cafe around. It's quickly becoming a worse, less friendly more expensive mac Donald's clone with its egg mcmuffin sandwiches. 

Seriously no reason to go back and so many reasons to actively avoid. Other business actually still try for customers.
author: Paula R.

description:
I honestly admit this is the best Starbucks I've been to.

Why?
They are attached to the side of Fifth & Mission Garage. Moscone Center, Metreon and Target are nearby. When you need a pastry and coffee for any reason, count on Starbucks. The service here is prompt, facility is clean, spacious and importantly; friendly team members. I was originally expecting to see a long line here since the next building is Moscone Center. This is partly because conference/lecture sessions, trade shows and auto shows take place at Moscone Center around this time of the year. From this point, it would be very obvious for event attendees to come in for their coffee break. Anyways, the line wasn't super when I came in today. Bonus points to a fast moving line!

Overall, positive experience here. So I'll definitely be back.

Reasons for rating:
- attached to the side of a public garage
- friendly team members
- prompt, courteous service
- clean, spacious facility

Nearby:
*City College of San Francisco (Downtown Campus)
*Target
*Metreon
*Moscone Center
*Yerba Buena Bowling Alley/Ice Skating Rink

It's always good to have a coffee shop nearby. Especially when seeking for the pastry and caffeine fix.
author: Bennett W.

description: This is the closest Starbucks to the ccsf branch I go to so it's perfect for my coffee perk up time before class.  There are no electrical outlets but the wifi is ok.  There's alot of people that come here while there's only a few tables.  There's  only 1 toilet here, so I wouldn't plan on staying for long.  In fact, it's easier to use my Starbucks app vs waiting in long lines.  While other Starbucks shops have comfy couches, you don't see that here.   But the drinks are well-made so overall, I don't have any real complaints.  If you don't want to wait in long lines, go to Target across the street 2nd floor near checkout near the online pickup orders area and they have a LARGE stall of toilets.  Protip - Do NOT leave even a bag of your stuff in a cart outside the Target restroom or it will be stolen by a thief who can look just as normal & respectable as you or me-  it almost happened to me!!
author: Frugal C.

description:
I'm so not happy right now. To have a Starbucks operating in a city that basically only allows bathroom use for "customers only" and there is no bathroom I just don't get it. 

I took the BART in from Walnut Creek and purposefully came into a Starbucks knowing I'd need to purchase something in order to have a restroom and when I get here, the newspapers are just sitting in front of the door. There is no signage or explanation of the situation. When I asked an associate he was completely clueless to why the stand was there. I asked several times of the bathrooms were operational and they all basically avoided the conversation with "ummm" and turning in circles nonsense. 

Sooooo... If you are hanging here today, using your Goldcard, getting your free drink refills, please know that you'll have to fend yourself attempting to locate a restroom elsewhere.
author: Crystal M.

description:
Unsure why it's three stars  this is an excellent Starbucks! With Corey as manager he runs a tight & fun environment! Everyone is super helpful and nice! We come here five days a week and we always  have the best customer service! 
This particular Starbucks is Very clean and the sugar straws area is always filled up for our convenience! To the Baristas keep up the awesome job!! YOU ROCK!!
author: Angelia A.

description:
Ok I've been to other Starbucks but this place is just awful and the staff clearly needs more training and this place is filthy.. The tables are sticky and not wiped down. 

I went here with my boyfriend and sister and 2 brothers and thought we should grab some Starbucks after watching a movie at the metreon before walking around San Francisco. 

When we came the line wasn't too long and there were 2 people working. We got our drinks after waiting what seemed like the usual wait time (10-15min maybe less) but it gave me a lot of time to observe. 

They were not stocked up on supplies, there were several customers that had to go up to barista to ask for milk, and the barista would look at them and just say "wait it's coming" when he clearly could've just stopped what he was doing for a second and give the poor lady some milk. Also when we got our drinks, they didn't have any venti straws and when we asked the same rude barista didn't bother to look at us and just said "yea I know, we are out"... What the hell! No I'm sorry or anything no acknowledgement of the customer. What was worst if they had mentioned that to us earlier before we ordered, we could've just gotten a smaller size. But no one had told us they were out of venti straws.. Do you know how hard and annoying it is to try to drink a venti frap with a small ass straw..while walking around the city. 

If I could give no stars I would. Starbucks need to re-train this barista on how to manage being busy and dealing with customers if not he clearly needs a job not in customer service. I will not return to this location, I'd rather try the spot across the street.
author: Rochelle M.

description:
I am usually a fan of Starbuck but I am so disappointed with this branch. 

Mocha Frappucino is my favorite drink and definitely I know what it tastes like. However today I got the worst tasting frappucino ever at 1pm. I asked a staff to redo my drink and it still tasted wrong.  He said he would use the same recipe that he had just done before. Obviously he doesn't know what the right recipe is !!!

Starbuck always impresses me with good customer service but they should train their staff to make the right drink.
author: Saruda P.

description: Starbucks gave us a generous donation for volunteer dental screening event at UOP Dental School. They are a great supporter of the community here, and I can always expect to find best quality coffee and best customer service. Thank you!
author: Sun Z.

description:
This was a welcome find having parked our car about 45 minutes early for our appointment.  We went inside to decompress and it wasn't crowded with tons of nervous people trying to get their caffeine before the work whistle blew.  We placed our order and even received a little extra courteous help from a barista.  Found a clean table and relaxed.  
Along with the usual candy bar coffee's we not only enjoy, but insist upon, we also purchased one of their orange juices.  It was so good I wish I had bought one for me instead.
Clean, locked bathrooms.  Ask for the key.  Great location.
author: Reba Jane S.

description:
Yay for no line at 1pm but boo for the actual drink. I'm not too happy with this espresso macchiato- if I hadn't been in a rush I'd go back and reorder it. Too bitter

Not knocking Starbucks for all the Carmel macchiato - pumpkin spice- concoctions - lovers, but Just not my style.  Wish the drink making skills were a bit more consistent. Every time I get a espresso macchiato, it's different from the last.
author: Ruby S.

description:
If I could give zero or negative stars, I would because this is the crappiest Starbucks I've been to. EVER. (And that's saying a lot living in an area on the other coast where I avoided Starbucks for over five years because the drinks and service were terrible.) Don't even think about mobile ordering. They'll sit on those orders and when you've been waiting for 15+ minutes and ask them what's up, they'll blankly stare at you and make it seem like it was a computer problem when the real problem was a human one.  If you order at the register, they won't get your order right because instead of helping you, they're gossiping with co-workers or former co-workers about how crappy things are for them. When maybe, just maybe the problem starts with them.

Bottom line, go to the store on a few blocks up on Market where the service is much better.
author: Sarah F.

description: Busy busy Starbucks!!! But Kate was awesome! Running back and forth helping everyone! She was definitely on top of it and really friendly!
author: Olivia R.

description: Drinks for venti size cup was not actually filled as a it should. When I ask if they could filled more on which I see that they have leftover ice blended of my drink or at lest filled it with more whipped cream. Or is it I used my reward that I am not deserve the full cup of Venti drink?
author: Melissa S.

description:
Staffed by a bunch of rude hipsters with little personality and a LOT of attitude. One barista was very short-tempered and strict about not letting anyone use the restroom until after a purchase had been made. When I asked to use the restroom he was visibly annoyed, said "UMMMM, the restroom is for customers only," and when I informed him I had bought a banana, he didn't seem too thrilled about having to exert the energy needed to walk 15 feet to let me in. He was rude to 3 or 4 other people as well in the span of 10 minutes, raising his voice and pointing his finger to redirect them to the public restrooms across the street.

Other than that, the floor was filthy, the WiFi was terrible (can't even stream a video), the banana was brown and gooey ... the only redeeming quality of this store is the location and the open, airy environment with it's big open windows a nice view of 4th street.

There is a better Starbucks literally across the street, go there instead.
author: Hailey G.

description: Great baristas who are quick and exacting with every concoction of drinks. The movement of the baristas from orders placed to completion of your order are done seemlessly as a solid working machine. Very courteous as well. Thanks 4th & Brannan crew for quick service and orders handled correctly.
author: Gina A.

description:
Worst layout of a Starbucks ever   for a massively high traffic area next to Moscone you'd think they'd put some planning into it.  The spot no wider than a hallway so let's put the line that goes out the door and the bathroom right at the apex of the line so people having to use the bathroom have to fight their way through 40+ people to pee.  

Crazy. Hope you have a half an hour for coffee if you come here at peak coffee times
author: Tom B.

description:
I was at this Starbucks more than a couple of times because I had attended a conference held at the Moscone Center (The American Diabetes Association Conference) which was a walking distance.

As you can imagine with their normal traffic daily and now due to the conference there were more people coming to this place. 

Service was slow and it took forever. What I didn't understand was that they have two registers but yet only one was used. How frustrating. I didn't have a lot of time in between sessions nor in the morning to be standing in line waiting to order my drink and food.

To top it off they ran out of yogurt parfait. To the manager(s) of this location, perhaps check the schedule of nearby locations, for this instance the Moscone Center, to see when they have a big event so you can order more things and have them out for customers to buy. 

Since it was super busy and crowded, staff were not too happy and didn't provide the WOW experience. I was a little disappointed.

Not enough tables, chairs and outlets for that particular 5 days that I was there.

Their drinks and food were similar to other Starbucks that I've been to so no complaints.
author: Jenny N.

description:
This Starbucks location was recently remodeled and looks quite nice inside. New good looking interior adds to the satisfaction brought to you by a magic drink--coffee. 

You might like your cup of happiness hot or cold, but the attitude for the customers is always warm here. Some say it might get crowded inside, and this is totally true since this is a central location. However, baristas are really nice guys and they are doing everything in their power to make the service as pleasant and as efficient as possible. Afternoon hours are more relaxed, so stop by after 2PM if not in a hurry.

This is my new favorite Starbucks location, give it a try if in the area! I hope you'll like it.
author: Julia G.

description:
What a joke

Ordered a black Tea lemonade and waited 10 minutes only to get just a black tea. Then they made me just a lemonade. After trying a third time to get the right drink the barista said they were out of tea and it would be 15 minutes!! The worst Starbucks!! I left without a drink and no refund.. Don't even easy your time in here everyone was getting wrong drinks and its a 10-15 minute wait in the unlikely event they make your drink right.. Frustrating for sure
author: Joshua H.

description:
I'm a regular at this place, but after this morning I've finally had it. I ordered a plain iced coffee, unsweetened that sat on the bar for 10 minutes while I watched other customers get served who had ordered their lattes and what not after me. It took 15 minutes from ordering to get served and it wasn't even a very busy day. 

Pros:
1. Starbucks 
2. Staff is relatively friendly

Cons:
1. Next to Moscone - You're packed in like a sardine at this place when there is a conference, which is to be expected.
2. Slow
3. Inconsistency - They mess up every once and a while, but I've had multiple mess ups in one visit. No free drink card like they've offered at other places.

Truthfully, I try not to complain. My very first job was at Dunkin Donuts on the east coast -- believe me, I understand. But with this location I. just. can't.
author: Christine M.

description: Over run by bums. I know not politically correct term, but I don't care. The whole place looks like a homeless shelter. Sad state of affairs. Good employees have to put up with it. Say when they call the police they come in an hour.
author: Logan E.

description:
This Starbucks is actually a 3.5 stars.  I left out of Target (going down the escalator) and decided I wanted a green tea frappuccino since I haven't had one of these in almost 10 years.  I used to get a blackberry green tea frappuccino, but Starbucks no longer carries it...too bad because it was my favorite.

I came at a very good time (after 1:00 PM).  Nobody was in line and probably about five people were sitting down and enjoying their java juice or whatever.

The baristas were friendly and pleasant as usual.  (I will have one venti green tea frappuccino with whipped cream, please, and the name is Carol.  The raspberry swirl pound cake looked tempting, but I decided to forego the sweet treat.)  Voila - in less than 5 minutes the barista had my green tea frappuccino ready to go.  Wow...instant service and I know that doesn't happen all the time.

I also noticed that Starbucks have two new flavored frappuccinos - mocha cookie chocolate frappuccino (?) and I can't remember the other flavor...okay, my CRS has crept up on me...LOL.
author: Carol C.

description: Cathy and the rest of the crew who work here are awesome, really friendly group, which I appreciate when I come to the store early in the morning for my pre-work drink.
author: Lexi T.

description:
Ok, the coffee was good. Service was quick and efficient. The place was clean and tidy. But can we please talk about those power chargers? Whaattttt. Let me explain.

They have these rings you plug into your phone (where you would normally plug in your charger) at the tables. After you plug that in, you place your phone over one of those circles on the table. The lights will go on and your phone will be charging pretty much wirelessly. That itself deserves five stars.
author: Felicity T.

description: Poor customer service! Unfriendly, messed up my order and the staff seemed more interest in chatting among themselves than anything else.
author: Chris W.

description:
I can't say this is my favorite Starbucks. Although the location serves as a prime spot located across from the Metreon, mall, and parking garage, this Starbucks store is a bit underwhelming.  The space is foreign seeing as how seating is at one end and the bar is so large it takes up most of the resting space.  When lines are created in the busy of the day the service seems daunting and trust me, it is.  No smile, no hello.  Just a mediocre coffee in hand and the rest of your day to think about ahead.

Make sure to take your drink to go.  You'll be glad you did.
author: Kevin J.

description:
It was really hard to look up the correct Starbucks, but this is MY Starbucks. I know Starbucks is the giant corporate monster it is but the staff there is awesome. I work in the neighborhood and enjoy starting my day with my Frapp or even making a mid day run for the staff at work
There crew at this location sees 1000000000s of faces a day but most remember and call me by name. Tara and all the staff provide quick and efficient customer service. At times I will go out of my way to go to only this location. Due to the staff there I have made the 4th and Mission Starbucks a part of my daily routine.
author: Chantal C.

description:
During convention time, get in line.

I have only come here when attending a convention.  This place can get overrun by convention attendees so you will need to bring your patience if a convention is in progress at Moscone Center.

But I was surprised that I could get a window seat even though there were hordes of people coming into the coffee shop.

Can't complain about my drink - how can you mess up a hot tea?
author: John F.

description:
you can spend here money but you can NOT redeem your free drinks here
I waited in line for 25 minutes and then barista told me that I have to go across a street.

Never ever will come back there
Stupid system
author: Marianna P.

description:
I believe people are confusing this starbucks with the other that is located across the street. The other is part of target in the metreon. This starbucks is connected to the garage and is next to moscone west. 

This starbucks is always extremely crowded. Its a very very small shop too so be prepared to take your drink and leave as seating is limited. If you do happen to find a seat you will most likely be sitting next to a bum as they frequent this one all the time. With the overcrowded line you can expect your drink to be rushed and not properly stirred/made.

Go to the other starbucks across the street or head over to 3rd street.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
Someone accidentally took my drink (even though it clearly had my name on it), and he took it to the area where you can put in some milk, grab napkins, etc. When his drink was called right after he took the drink, he came back, but he had already opened the top and put chocolate powder in the cup.

The barista remade the drink for me, but instead of using a new cup, she poured out the liquid in the previous cup and remade the drink for me in the same cup. After it had been touched and opened and added to by someone else.

I understand that there is some weird quota on the tall size cups due to inventory purposes or whatever, but someone else took off the lid and added stuff to the cup. The barista in question was also aware of this mixup as the gentleman came back to apologize to me in front of her prompting her to take the cup to remake the drink. I'm really disappointed because Starbucks from what I've seen so far tends to be big on sanitation, but this was really gross.

Normally I would've said something, but as soon as I realized that this lady was using the same cup, her phone went off and she either was done with her shift or on her break because she was swiftly replaced by a different barista.

At this point, with how busy and chaotic the location was (someone else thought my newly made coffee was theirs and tried to grab it as the barista called coffee with milk instead of a name), I just took my cup (and threw it away), but I don't think I'll be returning to this location anytime soon.
author: Jee K.

description: We came here two mornings in a row for the start to our busy days. The barista was able to offer me a caffeinated mocha with a shot of espresso that I actually liked. I usually don't like coffee, but this was pretty good! They were quick, and the line wasn't too long to wait in. It's conveniently located right by Market Street, but it's easier to walk here, rather than drive.
author: Chloe G.

description:
This is a Starbucks location with target which is not meant for a longer stay. If you plan to use your laptop of something like that, try the one across the street. This location is dirty and small. The restroom is filthy. The three stars come from the staff, which i have always found friendly and helpful. I go there few times a week and had never have any kind of disrespect or attitude from the staff. They should hire someone to clean the place and make the place more decent for their clientele. 
PS :The line was always pretty fast.
author: Ashish N.

description:
It's close to a lot of startups and the convention center. That's about all it has going for it. The tenderloin definitely spills over, with quite a few homeless people visiting often. Power outlets are very rare, wifi is slow. I definitely wouldn't suggest it for any other reason than to grab your coffee and be on your way. 

Starbucks is starbucks, so the coffee and food is exactly what you would expect. The rest is pretty shoddy.
author: Ved P.

description:
Thought I would give them a try again after going elsewhere for 6 months ...2 other Starbucks withn that corner. 

Nothing has changed.  Service still hasn't improved ...6 people behind the counter and only one register open.  My drink was called out before I even paid ...does that tell you there was a line.   Really ...drink was ready even before paying.  What does that tell you ...OPEN A SECOND REGISTER!   DUH!!!!!

Millon dollar question ...will I go back.  HELL NO ...2 other Starbucks in the same intersection. 

ps ...not a good image for your employees in uniform to smoke in front.  What does this tell you ...NOBODY CARES!!!!!
author: MickYee M.

description: ran out of pretty much everything and the typical water-down drip coffee starbucks style. if i weren't in a hurry i would've avoided starbucks at all cost.
author: Joyce C.

description: I have mixed feelings about this particular starbucks. Usually I go to the one with a shorter line, between this one & the one across the street. Most of the time the drinks I order here are watered down or taste straight up like milk.
author: Diane Y.

description: Always busy! You would think this is a sign of great service, but it is more an indication of the Moscone Center being so close to the location. They are always out of milk at the coffee station, so it gets tiring asking for milk constantly to add to my coffee. I would go elsewhere, but this spot is on my walk to work.
author: Bradley V.

description: This one is overpriced, I guess it makes sense being where it is but still.  Also, the area to line up is way too small.  Otherwise, the stuff you get is what you get at all the other Starbucks'.
author: Kay C.

description: I like coming to these folks. I usually park at the 5th and mission garage then stop by here before heading to work. They're very friendly and always have a smile on their faces even when it gets super busy. Its a very busy one, but all their orders come out fast and on point. Thanks guys for helping everyone start of their morning right!
author: Sunny P.

description:
Depending on the time of day, this Starbucks can get pretty busy. It is connected to the 5th and Mission Garage and Mel's Diner. Try a toffee nut iced coffee, always gets me going for the day.

The customer service here is always up and down. Depending who you get, some people are friendly but sometimes sour attitudes wash over the place. Pete's is down the street.
author: Briana W.

description:
This place gets packed during a trade show at Moscone Center. It is right down the block from Moscone West, and just a block away from Moscone North and South halls. 

It is a long a narrow Starbucks, and it is right under the 5th and Mission city parking lot, near the 4th and Mission entrance. 

Staff is efficient, making the line which is here during trade shows move quickly. 

There is seating in the back, or in this case, to the right of the counter.
author: Wanugee N.

description: Pretty decent service, but their water filter has clearly not been changed out in months, if not longer. Please change the water filter regularly. It affects the taste of every drink, and unmaintained filters will cause the espresso machine to eventually break down and require expensive repairs. The Chipotle across the street always has excellent water. Why aren't you prioritizing your liquids, Starbucks? Why does a burrito chain have cleaner water than a chain that specializes in liquids? This customer demands answers.
author: I V.

description: standard starbucks and located right before you hit union square area. its a bigger starbucks compared to some of the others in the area. super nice staff that are very accomodating.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
Nothing much different than any other starbucks, except it's right next to Moscone. So it's busy. Whether it's locals, who go there daily or the 5000 people at a Moscone conference, it's a busy place.

The crew is fast, friendly and pretty cool. You do have to suffer the frequent hobo walking in looking for a potty and asking (loudly) for the code to the bathroom.

Sometimes the hobos come in to beg and are promptly run off by the staff, kudos
author: john W.

description: Disappointing. Long wait a Saturday morning. Lack of supplies. And my single latte was flavored!
author: Hector L.

description: (See pics) Review #1277. Part of Target and is a slightly quicker pickup than the long line at La Boulange in the morning. Because it's still quite new, the place was clean with the new shop scent and is better maintained. Wish they carried La Boulange pastries now that it's one big family.
author: T L.

description: Went in for a bagel and received the BEST costumer service from Damian ( I think that's his name, he's the AA male with long hair). Even though I was beginning to get frustrated with another barista he came in and made my experience enjoyable!! Management of Starbucks, GIVE HIM A RAISE!
author: Nykk B.

description: Greated with the smell of urine and B.O. Ahhhhh, the charm of SF is so lovely.  Wouldn't expect anything less from a Starbucks in the city. Drink order was good and made quickly. Close to my hotel so I like that. Employees weren't so friendly, more like jaded than anything. But then again if I had to work around bums and the smell of BO and urine all day I wouldn't be so friendly either.  Lots of seating but all taken up by robotic coders from all the local tech companies with their predictable white ear buds stuck in place.   Wouldn't you think if you lived and worked in the city you wouldn't be in front of your accult issued Apple laptop and enjoy whatever it is you're supposed to Enjoy in the city?
author: Jeff C.

description: This place is like a homeless shelter. Smells and no room for paying customers. These two people have a pile of junk around a table they're sorting. They retrieved empty cups from the garbage. I need a place to WORK! Ask them to leave! Won't be back if they don't do some enforcement of the people living in here. Baristas were nice.
author: Heart T.

description: PEOPLE! Please don't get this starbucks confused with the Target Starbucks across the street! This location is an actual Starbucks owned by Starbucks, not Target. You CAN redeem free drinks here!
author: Jeremiah L.

description:
For a Starbucks... I'm a little disappointed.

Leave the bad attitude for the artsy independent coffeehouses. The place seemed a little dirty and unkempt. 

Going on for a Vanilla latte, I had the door closed in my face by a person who happened to be on his way to work... at the Starbucks I was walking into. Sadly, he only became polite after clocking in. 

Although I was served by a barista who appeared unshowered and unkempt, with a large hickey on his neck, I will say that the coffee is what you would expect from a Starbucks. Tasty and consistent.
author: Jeff B.

description: I skip this starbucks a lot because of the lines, but when I can get in it's a good one.  Usually clean with a nice staff, the location can't be beat in terms of convenience for my commute so I am thankful for that.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
Another dose of your normal strong, consistent Starbucks Coffee. It's interesting - there are three Starbucks within rock throwing distance of each other. This one is on the street across from the Metreon - which also has a Starbucks inside, and there is another one in the Lobby of the San Francisco Marriott. And all of them are busy all the time.

I hit this Starbucks every morning whenever I come out to attend Apple's Worldwide Developer's Conference in June, and I stopped here yesterday for a cup O' Joe.

Sometimes this Starbucks feels like an oven inside - not sure what the hell is going on with their temperature control - it definitely needs some work!
author: Neal E.

description: One of the worst Starbucks around. The large dark lady with tattoos on the arms is pretty mean to the customers.
author: Larry C.

description:
This is a good Starbucks.

To all the Yelpers complaining about this or that, remember- it's a "convention store," Being in such close proximity to the Moscone center means there's going to be massive lines at times, mistakes here and there, and the like.

For how busy these guys are they do a great job. One particular barista is AWESOME- (tall, blond curly hair) He always smiles at you and goes out of the way to make sure you have what you need.

Like I stated, it IS busy. And this one doesn't have couches or comfy chairs- if you're looking to hang around for hours studying, you'd be better checking out one of the other ones.
author: Ashley P.

description:
Easy access with a good amount of seating.

If I want Starbucks, I'll stop by this one on the way to work. I've also sat here and done work. It can get packed if the Moscone Center is hosting a large event though. One time a sorority was having a national conference, and boy was the line for days!

Luckily, the baristas here are speedy like Olympic tracks stars. The staff is very nice and they do their best to keep the tables tidy and ready to occupy.

There's a single restroom and multiple seats. However, sometimes shady characters come up in this joint. One time I was doing some work and some guy kept messing with the temperature. One of the staff told him he couldn't do that and definitely tried to get into an argument with him. Luckily he stopped and eventually left. I'm glad that the staff knows to keep potentially aggressive customers calm.

Anyway, if you need your Starbucks stop by. Just expect to wait a little.

Until next time, happy caffeine hunting!
author: Valerie A.

description: I used to like this Starbucks, but no more. It's a convenient location, if you're on the way to somewhere nearby. But, if you're on the way somewhere, you might not have the time to wait 10 minutes, then try to get someone's attention to find out where your drink is, etc. The last time I was there, I finally gave up and walked out. I lost $5, but I got to the movie on time.
author: Bruce S.

description:
Use the mobile app, place your order before you plan on getting there.
Pick up your drink and food the end of the counter.
Not the most pleasant place to actually spend time in.

Does the job, it's a Starbucks right. It the queue extends beyond the door, forget it.
author: Geordie E.

description:
Not meeting the Starbucks standard. Drink / milk and sugar station was dirty and most sugars empty. When I asked for them to refill the Splenda they just handed me two packets and went back to the bar. Too bad for the next guy that wants some. 

Also, wifi is unusably slow. Had to leave to go to another Starbucks.
author: Jimmy B.

description: Courtney was the worst barista ever. I've never in my life received such horrible customer service. He made us wait as he chatted with his co workers before taking our drinks. He gave me attitude. He questioned me, mugged me, and thought he deserved a thanks from me. It was so embarrassing and he should not be a "barista".
author: Sally T.

description:
Good locale to grab an espresso before heading in to catch a movie, as it is located across from the 4th & Minna Streets' entrance to the Metreon. Can also stay as there are a number of seats/tables - with quick customer turnover - and there are many tourists to hang with.

Bonus review since it's related: "Bruno" = "Borat" meets "Religulous"...again it's part-comedy, part-documentary style with a semblance of a "plot". Many disturbing images and uncomfortable moments...just a warning to those homophobes who did like "Borat". Really liked the soundtrack.
author: Peter L.

description:
The people there are really friendly and always greet you with a smile. When they have a chance, they will chat with you will mixing drinks. They check in to see if the drink is to your like when you ask for it special.

It is hard at times to predict when it will be busiest in the morning, but they get through the line pretty quick and it's worth the wait.
author: Rachel N.

description:
I'm a Starbucks Shareholder,  I was there and wanted my Iced Mocha along with my personal Starbucks cup on top of that I do have a printed label stating what exactly what i am requesting for.

First things first, no one greeted us at this location. it's all good, I'll let it slide. The cashier said "what do you want?" I told her I want an Grande, Iced Mocha, extra light on the ice and No whip cream, whole milk, Then she tripped out and said what...you want coffee??!! I advised her I didn't say anything about coffee. 
So I pretty much I repeated myself 3x slowly and she though I wanted White Mocha.  Then she started to trip out by telling me how much it would not fill up the entire cup and replied  "NO" you will fill it up to the top"!

looked at her like she was crazy..I won't mention the cashiers name but I told the cashier that what I want is on the label !

She did not understand and I told her to "Calm down, and take it easy" Getting high off your own supply is a no-no, all jittery..she was quite entertaining but I was getting pissed. The drink came up at the bar and it was White Mocha with whip cream..Good grief Charlie Brown!...The Bartista re-made the drink and I was out the door after 13 min.  

"You're supposed to smoke crack, not chew it"

Hope you have a better experience.
author: Smooth R.

description:
The wifi connection doesn't work that i have to connect to another networl. Although I come to that starbucks since it's across from CCSF that the service is ok but I expect better

Such as the line which was pact that I was 5 to 15 minutes late all for  just a cakepop and ice tea.

Guess I better check the convention schedule then...
author: Cindy G.

description: I was so surprised to see how many people were waiting for this Starbucks to open when we first got to SF early in the morning!
author: Lingfei H.

description: AMAZING!  In a busy, bustling city, this Starbucks is a refuge from the craziness, a real pleasure to be treated so well! Every employee here went above & beyond to make us feel welcome and right at home! A very personalized experience! Thank you for such a pleasant visit!
author: Sara F.

description: Prime location (although there's another Starbucks across the street), pretty much your average Starbucks. Busy as hell but still good and quick service.
author: Rowena L.

description:
Came here after a meeting.  It's Starbucks, what can really go wrong?

Nice, clean and organized.  The staff is friendly and efficient :)
author: Alicia A.

description: they are polite and respectful of ALL customers. there have been a couple of times that I have needed to charge my phone or use a restroom and they haven't hassled me so, I think they are for the most respectful
author: Grant S.

description: Good BIG Starbucks with lots of seating and prepared staff for large crowds and quick turnaround.
author: Mahsa K.

description:
Writing from within this Starbucks - and I was so disgusted I felt the need to right a review right this minute. I understand I am arriving late in the day - but this place is a dirty mess. I am counting 3 tables covered in cups and napkins and straws all over the floor, but what is worse is how dirty the barista bar is. I over heard that they are out of paper towels? so the bar is covered in various liquids and there is a pile of some white powder next to the ice tea. As a result the barista, with his wet hands from the counter, handed me my coffee... With his wet hands on the lid. Really made me lose my appetite. I took the lid off, but I can't get the visual I how unsanitary the conditions appeared. 

Being a busy location is not an excuse. I go to the Starbucks in the mall and on Powell and sutter a couple times a week - basically what I am trying to say is all Starbucks are busy so it is not an excuse to be this dirty.

Luckily they are on every corner, so I don't have to come back.
author: Jessica B.

description: They made our soy green tea lattes just right! The only complaint I have is there is a smell of urine. Other than that, great service and close enough to both AMC and Century so that you can have some great coffee with a movie!
author: Kat P.

description:
I LOVE STARBUCKS!! I mean LIVE WITH A PASSION THAT RIVALS A HOBBY BY DEFINITION. This locale along with the one on Market and third seems to have the barista rejects. Rude, mocking their customer as if they were in High School,
And just down right incompetent. The wifi NEVER works here. The ac outlets are exposed hazardly so. And its ALWAYS packed. Though the packed part I dint mind too much because usually thats a good sign. Not here though. Its just packed full of one timers or desperado's who don't have the knowledge or time to venture towards a better Starbuck's
Really sad. Cause this Starbucks used to be my hangout from 2003 until 2008. And I swear the ONLY THING that kept from reaching over the counter and smacking the taste out the barista's mouth and their man looking ager was my faith, not wanting to be stuck in lockup and the coffee. The coffee soothes me.
Rest assured one these days one of ya is gonna catch me when NONE of these things matter. And then you'll have a first hand knowledge of what cold blooded, and victims means... Just sayin ;)
author: Crista S.

description: This starbucks had horrible service. There was a Starbucks right across the street from this one but this one was closer so I decided to go to this one. I walked it and there was a line so I waited and I was standing behind another customer and wen it was my turn the barista said you have to get in line and do not cut and she gave me attitude. I told her I've been waiting in line and she just looked away. I ordered a caramel mocchiato and when I got it, it was way too sweet.
author: Jeffery C.

description: Wifi doesnt work here, and everytime i go there, i see a bunch of indian guys just sit there with no drinks! I paid for the drink but i have to stand up! Funny~
author: Max H.

description: Very busy when I came in on a Friday morning. But the staff was really friendly and fast in service. Dominic was awesome!
author: Arvee E.

description: This Starbucks is located in a prime location for Moscone attendees and therefore is often packed with customers during conferences - especially in the early AM.  I've seen lines backed out of the door and keep on moving.    For the volumes done in this store, the staff has always been pleasant but clearly on a mission - serving the customers.   They have little time for idle chat given the fast pace they operate under.  My hats off to these teams b/c when 25K people descend on the Moscone for events, those folks really hold it together.  Getting served can take a while, so if you want some exercise, there are several other Starbuck's  (and other coffee vendors) only a block or two away.  Seek.  Cheers.
author: G M.

description: This Starbucks reminds me very much of another Starbucks I once visited.  They sell the same things that this other Starbucks sold.  The other Starbucks was not conveniently located between my hotel and the convention center though...
author: Kent K.

description: I go to a few different Starbucks throughout the week, and this one is by far my favorite! The staff is always friendly and helpful, and my drinks are made perfectly every time! The flow of traffic seems inconsistent (from what I can tell) and it really depends on the convention that is happening at Moscone, but when it gets slammed they get the drinks out quickly.  This Starbucks DEFINITELY helped me reach my 30 Stars goal for the rewards program, I can't wait to get and use my gold card there :)
author: T M.

description:
Yes, a Starbucks in a parking lot!  

I'm not sure which addiction applies, food, coffee, or Yelping.  But I found myself looking at my watch this afternoon, hoping I would get to school early enough to enjoy a grande nonfat latte ($3.20, just like most other downtown locations).  

Since the cafe is wedged into a wall of a garage, it's long and narrow, and has two doors on the street.  Nice furniture, bright enough lighting because the whole street-side wall is glass, and Brazilian dance music on the sound system.  

Hella ghetto chick here screaming on her cell phone.  Hopefully she won't be here the next time I drop by.
author: David D.

description: I love them and specially Pete and Shy. Pete the manager when he realized I am a regular and how much not having pumpkin bread ruined my head... he said he'd order it! Now that ROCKS! The only time this place is not usually a shorter line is when Moscone has something going on. Other wise its a chill place that is has great service.
author: Natasha M.

description:
First day: a very loud and almost rude girl at the cash register. Makes all people in line feel like cows in need of directions. I had to wait 10 minutes for some Half & half. All tables are covered with cups, dirty napkins, etc.

Second day: a guy at the cash register asking me to repeat several time "medium coffee" and replying "do you mean grande?"  I still refuse to call the medium size "grande"! Sorry Starbucks. The little table with milk and 1/2&1/2 is in terrible conditions. Nobody seems to care.

Third day: I don't think there will ever be a third day.
author: Frank F.

description:
This location seems to have a lot of different teams of employees.  Some are really nice and some are less than helpful.  I witnessed one cashier telling a customer who was already irritated with his service that "business is business" and that she has to pay the extra 20 cents for the green tea latte that she thought she ordered originally even though they made her a grande latte.  I got pretty angry at a cashier who refused to give me the change in cash for my starbucks card, even though there was a sign right in front of the register that they are required by law to do so.  

It's a great location, for me and a lot of others, but it's not usually crowded.  It all depends on the conference schedule.
author: Amy D.

description:
So I'm not a fan of starbucks.. I'm a Peets or a Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf.. BUT.. after parking in the garage and heading towards the Metreon for a movie, we had about an hour to waste and decided "lets get some coffee."

So this Starbucks is literally built right into the garage.. There was a side door that actually let's you IN right from exiting the garage.

Anyway, everyone here was super friendly, didn't laugh or give me weird looks for my weird coffee request, and my drink was seriously done in less than a minute. It's a big spot, there's more than one stand to get your straws/sugar/napkins etc. and surprisingly.. NO homeless people at all wandering around inside! Weird, considering the neighborhood. 

My drink was fine, not oversugary or SOUR like a lot of starbucks (why i hate them so much) and we could actually sit down at a CLEAN table for once.THEN I was able to come back later with that $2 iced drink after 2pm deal which was a good bargain. LOL..
author: Diana R.

description: i used to work right next to this place and used to be here almost every day. i recently went again when i was in the city and they are just as good as they always have been. drinks made fast and well. very consistent service. it is interesting that their is an other Starbucks inside target right across the street. i would always recommend coming to this one because the Starbucks in target dont give you points for Starbucks rewards and if you are a regular Starbucks drinker like me that is a big deal.
author: Sarmad N.

description: This is my regular sbux, and on the scale of 'bucks experiences, these guys fall pretty high.  The services is always quick (despite the inevitable and intimidating lines around the Moscone conferences), and they've never, ever messed up my order.  They're friendly and fast - what more could I want out of my morning coffee routine?
author: Allison B.

description: This spot is always full of conventioneers and even though the line can get long the staff can move through it pretty quickly.
author: Roger H.

description: A Starbucks with bad customer service, shocking!  But I found it here on 4th and Mission.  The manager Pete (if that's his real name) is a bad example to his employees and needs to go back to customer service training. He was rude and demeaning then played dumb when I called him on it.  On on his employees apologized for his behavior instead of himself.
author: Jewel A.

description: Perfunctory Starbucks with sorta space cadet-y cashiers.  Starbucks is wearing on me a little bit and that was only confirmed by the drink that I got from here.  I ordered my usual, a skinny vanilla latte, which tasted less like coffee and more like a chemically sugary sweet.  My fault for ordering this beverage, although they didn't use to taste so odd.  Other than that, it is a fine place to sit for a bit and have some kinda acrid tasting caffeine!
author: Prettylilredhead H.

description: I GUESS you can call this place decent. When I was getting a yogurt parfait and paying for it, the woman at the cash register told me to put the cash ON THE TABLE instead of where I was putting originally next to the cash register. And she said it in an attitude that was so rude, I probably won't go there again.
author: Lyn U.

description:
This Starbucks is near the Moscone Center. So when you see all corporate america coming here from Moscone Center, THEY ARE NOT PAYING FOR IT OUT OF POCKET. They are having this come out of their company's pocket as "a necessity". Imagine 4.50 for a triple venti mocha, no foam hazelnut latte and a scone will run you about 7.00.  

Lets examine starbucks carefully and what a waste to their stockholders this is. 

#1, there is a starbucks on every block, there is one on 5th street, a few on market street, 2 on 4th street (this one and IN the metreon), in powell bart station. 

#2, think of the overhead (rent, employees (30k per employee plus stock options and benefits)

#3, the specialized coffee prices. Expensive. 
(Go to Target and buy a latte machine, yikes)

If Starbucks was smart, they would eliminate all the "excessive" store locations. I guess that's why they finally wised up in this unstable economy and are closing alot of their stores. And lets face it, the powell street starbucks is a waste of breath...if you say you open at 5am and put a sign on your door on a daily basis that says "We'll be open at 5:20, but you're really going to show up at 5:45, then guess how much business you've lost.
author: Charlene C.

description: Been addicted to starbucks. this one is pretty good service, and can make my drink right. so a A-OK for you!
author: Monika T.

description: They certainly aren't the fastest; but when hours early for your movie, it makes for a good pit stop. And there's always some crazy people outside to watch as you wait...
author: Morgan A.

description: The customer service here sucks.. I asked for the code to the restroom and the Barista tells me you have to be a customer to use the restroom.. Then I tell her I am a customer and she unhappily tells me the code. I tried the code and it dint work.. I went back to her and repeated the code and she confirmed that it is indeed the code..She had an extremely stony expression on her face and it felt like she was doing me a huge favor.. I tried it again and it dint work.. Finally i went to another Barista and found out that the code I was told was incorrect.. I am a very frequent Starbucks customer but this is the first time I experienced something like this.. The  1 star is for the good coffee they made..
author: Chandrika G.

description: Clean place & bathroom, full of space and interesting art, wifi and cell reception, large windows to watch people walk by, & speedy service!  Interesting and helpful baristas and the items are fully stocked and eco-friendly.
author: R C.

description: Yes.  I have to admit that I'm one of those pain in the ass customers.  I usually order a grande green tea soy latte extra hot with no melon.  The reason I do this is simply because i like and i can.  For a while, I was so addicted to it that I had to have one everyday.  And, what makes this Starbucks better than the others is the friendly staff.  They KNOW what i order and even suggest that I get it without the syrup if I don't want it too sweet.  Oh, by the way, I also like green tea light frappucino with coffee base (instead of cream base).  Despite the weird greenish brown color, the flavor of matcha and coffee blend surprisingly well, and the double caffeine definitely makes you very VERY happy.
author: Vivian H.
